question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola pull back any items because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola issues a recall for any of its items due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially acknowledged by Coca-Cola or an appropriate food safety authority (like the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances discovered in the food products. If no such recall takes place within the given timeframe, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Given Coca-Cola recalls products due to metal contamination by August 2024, will Danone also recall products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body:

The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority and reported by at least two reputable news sources. para_P.body:

In that case, will Danone declare a recall for any of its products due to metal contamination by August 31, 2024? This recall must be officially verified by Danone or a relevant food safety authority and reported by at least two credible news outlets. question.title: Will both Coca-Cola and Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone announce recalls of any of their products due to metal contamination. Each recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If either company does not announce such a recall within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola and Danone both initiate product recalls due to metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone declare recalls of any of their products because of metal contamination. Each recall must be officially verified by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a pertinent food safety authority (like the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, or New York Times). The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances discovered in the food items. If either company fails to announce such a recall within the given timeframe, the question will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is Indiana expected to hold a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative conclusion, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Indiana.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such public vote that fulfills these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually carrying it out by the specified deadline does not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Given Indiana conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana, primarily focused on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth? The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Indiana holds a public vote regarding abortion rights before August 2024, will Colorado implement a new statute changing the regulations on medical treatment for transgender minors by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, Indiana carries out a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. This vote must be officially announced and executed by the state of Indiana, primarily concentrating on the safeguarding of abortion rights, with the outcomes publicly disclosed through official state channels or well-known news organizations.

Then, is it accurate that by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado passes a new statute that alters or supersedes the existing regulations on medical treatment for transgender minors? The passage of this statute must be verified through official records of state legislation and reported by at least two prominent news sources. The new statute must directly address and modify the current regulations on medical treatment for transgender minors in Colorado. If no such statute is passed by the specified date, or if any statute passed does not alter the existing regulations, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana, primarily focused on abortion rights protection, and publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) Colorado enacts a new law by July 31, 2024, that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado.

If either (a) or (b) does not occur by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) will Indiana hold a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024, and (b) will Colorado pass a new law changing the limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following events take place:

(a) Indiana holds a public vote explicitly aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Indiana, with a primary focus on safeguarding abortion rights, and it should be reported by official state channels or well-known news organizations.

(b) Colorado passes a new law by July 31, 2024, that alters or supersedes the current limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth. The passing of this law must be verified through official state legislative documentation and covered by at least two major news outlets. The new legislation must specifically address and modify the existing limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth in Colorado.

If either (a) or (b) fails to happen by the specified deadlines, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

para_P.body:

question.title: Given Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state, meeting all the specified criteria.

Then, will Tennessee enact new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, as confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources?

para_P.title: If Pennsylvania holds a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024, will Tennessee implement more stringent abortion laws by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state, fulfilling all necessary conditions.

In that case, will Tennessee introduce new legislation or regulations by July 31, 2024, that enforce more rigorous standards on abortion providers relative to other healthcare providers, as verified by official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news outlets?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Pennsylvania will hold a referendum regarding abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Tennessee will implement new abortion regulations that are more stringent than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania will organize a public referendum aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative outcome, the following stipulations must be satisfied:
   1. The referendum must be formally announced and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary emphasis of the referendum must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
   3. The results of the referendum must be disclosed through official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.
   If no referendum that meets these requirements occurs by August 31, 2024, this aspect of the inquiry will conclude as negative.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee will introduce new laws or regulations that enforce more rigorous standards on abortion providers in comparison to other healthcare providers. The implementation must be verified through official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news organizations. Stricter standards may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility criteria specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the specified date, or if any laws or regulations enacted apply uniformly to all healthcare providers, this segment of the inquiry will also conclude as negative.

Both criteria (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for this inquiry to conclude as affirmative. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry will conclude as negative.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce a new timetable system for freight train operations before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into action a new timetable system aimed at enhancing the predictability of schedules for freight train operations. The execution must be validated through official announcements from the company or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The new system must be explicitly designed to tackle the quality of life issues associated with schedule predictability for freight train operations. If such a system is not implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for freight train operations, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Conditional on Union Pacific implementing a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024, will they reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. Then, will Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors by August 31, 2024? The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Union Pacific introduces a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024, will they establish a new contract with the conductors' union that focuses on the predictability of work schedules by that same date?

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of these take place: (a) Union Pacific introduces a new scheduling system for freight train operations, and (b) Union Pacific establishes a new agreement with the conductors' union that tackles work schedule predictability?

The agreement must directly confront the issue of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing dispute. If either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid plan that requires community involvement by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid plan that necessitates community involvement for beneficiaries. question.title: Given another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024, will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?

The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For this to be true, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). Then, is it true that the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, will exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES, the specified condition must be met within the timeframe. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for resolution.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will a prominent cybersecurity firm have completely moved its headquarters to Austin, Texas?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has entirely shifted its headquarters from its initial location to Austin, Texas. For the answer to be YES:

1. The company or its executives must make an official announcement regarding the relocation.
2. This announcement needs to be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters in Austin, Texas must be operational, with essential executive functions established there.

Any partial relocations or ongoing plans as of July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES answer. If the relocation is not finalized and functioning by this date, or if the firm opts against the move, the response will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on a major cybersecurity company fully relocating its headquarters to Austin by July 2024, will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters to Austin, Texas. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership and reported by at least two major, reputable news sources. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred. Partial relocations or plans still in progress by the deadline will not be sufficient.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Google will face additional legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity? These legal actions may include lawsuits or regulatory actions and must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets. They must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If a prominent cybersecurity firm completely moves its headquarters to Austin by July 2024, will Google encounter further legal challenges from the U.S. government by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: By July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has entirely shifted its headquarters to Austin, Texas. This move must be formally announced by the company or its executives and covered by at least two major, credible news organizations. The new headquarters must be functional in Austin, Texas, with essential executive roles transferred. Incomplete relocations or plans that are still being developed by the deadline will not suffice.

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, Google will confront additional legal challenges initiated by any U.S. government agency? These challenges may encompass lawsuits or regulatory measures and must be officially disclosed and reported by at least two major news outlets. They must be separate from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are launched by the resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major cybersecurity company fully relocates its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024, and (b) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this to resolve as YES:
   1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
   2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
   3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.
   Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be met for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A prominent cybersecurity firm completely moves its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024, and (b) Google encounters further legal challenges from the U.S. government by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) By July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its headquarters from its previous location to Austin, Texas. For this to be resolved as YES:
   1. The relocation must be officially declared by the company or its executives.
   2. The declaration must be reported by at least two major, credible news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
   3. The new headquarters must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive operations moved.
   Partial relocations or plans still underway by July 31, 2024, will not suffice for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not finalized and operational by this date, or if the company opts against the relocation, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Google is subjected to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. governmental body. These legal actions may encompass, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and covered by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be separate from any existing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Both criteria (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for this question to be resolved as YES. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Mexico as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Mexico's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Stanford University provide complete tuition coverage for undergraduate students hailing from low-income families?

The agreement should directly address the issue of safety protocols for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address safety protocols, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the state of Texas introduce new abortion laws that are more stringent than those applicable to other healthcare providers before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas passes new legislation or regulations that impose more rigorous standards on abortion providers than on other healthcare providers. Official state legislative documentation or confirmation from at least two credible news outlets must verify the enactment. More stringent standards may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility requirements specifically for abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are enacted by the deadline, or if any laws or regulations enacted are uniformly applicable to all healthcare providers, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on Texas enacting stricter abortion regulations by July 2024, will Alabama hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, Alabama will officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights? The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Alabama state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Texas implements more stringent abortion laws by July 2024, will Alabama carry out a vote on abortion rights by that same date?
para_P.body:

Stricter requirements could involve, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are specific to abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations are applicable to all healthcare providers equally, the condition is not satisfied.

Then, is it the case that by July 31, 2024, Alabama will officially hold a statewide vote specifically regarding abortion rights? This vote must pertain to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or making significant changes to existing abortion laws. For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared by the Alabama state government and the voting process must be finalized by the resolution date. The occurrence and outcomes of the vote must be reported by at least two major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant national newspapers). question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Texas enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers, and (b) Alabama holds a referendum on abortion rights?

Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. question.title: Will Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Google officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be further layoffs from Google beyond the initially disclosed 8% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Google makes an official announcement regarding additional layoffs exceeding the initially disclosed 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 8% workforce reduction. If no further layoffs are announced by the deadline, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications regarding the original 8% reduction without indicating new layoffs, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Conditional on Google announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024, will a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024?
question.body:

The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction.

Then, will a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, this condition will be considered unmet. Simple preparatory tasks like site clearing or obtaining permits do not qualify as the commencement of construction. If no such construction has initiated by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, this condition will be considered unmet. question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of New Zealand introduce a fresh economic stimulus initiative before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand officially unveils a new economic stimulus initiative. The announcement should clearly outline the new economic stimulus initiative. Additionally, it must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the Reserve Bank of New Zealand continues with the existing economic policy, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the Central Bank of New Zealand announces a new economic stimulus package by August 2024, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid.

Then, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024? This question resolves as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the Reserve Bank of New Zealand declares a new economic stimulus initiative by August 2024, will the KOSPI index of South Korea achieve or surpass 3,500 points by that time?

Verification will rely on official index reports from credible financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not need to finish the day at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Central Bank of New Zealand issues a new economic stimulus package, and (b) South Korea's KOSPI index hits or surpasses 3,500 points?

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not fall into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of declining GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the UK economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will General Motors' quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The UK economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. 

Then, is it true that General Motors will report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024? This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming the UK economy remains free from recession by July 2024, will General Motors' quarterly net profit rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: The UK economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024, which means it avoids experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the UK's Office for National Statistics from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. 

In that case, can we confirm that General Motors will disclose a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the corresponding quarter from the previous year, in its official financial disclosures published by July 31, 2024? This increase must be substantiated through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If there is no such increase reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The UK economy avoids a recession, and (b) General Motors' quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the stated deadline.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the given timeframe.

Given this scenario, will the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) announce the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics by July 31, 2024? For the FTC investigation completion to be true, the investigation must involve at least five major companies, and completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times.

question.body:

The reduction must be concrete, not merely hinted or speculated.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Conditional on the Bank of England announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body:

Suppose the following is true: The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

Then, is the following true? By July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The exit should involve a reorganization plan sanctioned by the court, enabling GNC Holdings to operate with a restructured financial framework. question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approve a significant economic reform legislation that Prime Minister Sunak opposes before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. To be considered valid:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic matters, such as government spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes enacted law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be distinctly reported by at least two major global news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be referred to as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential effects on the UK economy.

If the House of Lords does not pass such legislation by August 31, 2024, or if legislation is passed but does not fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Given the UK House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak, will Apple finalize a union contract with Ohio store employees by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the House of Lords. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy. 

Then, will Apple finalize and officially sign a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio by July 31, 2024? The contract must be confirmed by official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the House of Lords in the UK enacts a significant economic reform legislation that Prime Minister Sunak is against, will Apple complete a union agreement with employees at its Ohio stores by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom enacts a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. This legislation must pertain to economic matters, such as government spending, taxes, or monetary policy, and it has to be approved by the House of Lords. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential effects on the UK economy. 

Consequently, will Apple complete and officially endorse a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized store workers in Ohio by July 31, 2024? The agreement must be verified by official statements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or leading national newspapers). This agreement must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If the finalization and signing of the agreement do not take place by the specified deadline, or if the agreement remains tentative or not finalized, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the UK's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by PM Sunak by August 2024, and (b) Apple finalizes a union contract with Ohio store employees by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

2. By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) the House of Lords in the UK enacts a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak opposes by August 2024, and (b) Apple completes a union agreement with employees at its Ohio stores by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of these conditions are satisfied:

1. By August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom enacts a significant economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. The bill must pertain to economic policy, including areas like fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy. The House of Lords must pass the bill, regardless of its eventual status as law. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be documented by at least two major international news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the UK economy.

2. By July 31, 2024, Apple has completed and officially ratified a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized employees at its stores in Ohio. Verification must come from official statements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or leading national newspapers). This contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either or both of these conditions are unmet, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not slipped into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP as indicated by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the inquiry will be considered negative if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given the Italian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). This question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: If the Italian economy successfully avoids a recession by July 2024, will the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric reflect a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not experience a recession, which is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, will the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicate a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024? This increase must be officially documented by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). This inquiry pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession, and (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) The Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy remains free from recession, and (b) The inflation measure favored by the Federal Reserve indicates a monthly rise that surpasses 0.5%?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: 

(a) The Italian economy does not fall into a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The inquiry will be answered with a NO if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) The inflation measure preferred by the Federal Reserve (generally the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) shows a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially released by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If there is no such increase reported during this timeframe, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by India's central bank display a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the inflation metric favored by India's central bank indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body, and confirmed by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Economic Times). Should there be no reported increase in this timeframe, the outcome will be NO. It is important to note that this question pertains specifically to month-over-month changes, rather than year-over-year or any alternative time periods.

question.title: Conditional on India's central bank's preferred inflation measure showing a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times).

Then, is it true that Uber will lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan? Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

para_P.title: Given that India's central bank's favored inflation indicator registers a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber terminate at least 1,800 jobs by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: India's central bank's favored inflation indicator indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This rise must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or a pertinent Indian governmental body and covered by at least two reliable financial news outlets (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times).

Then, is it accurate to say that Uber will cut at least 1,800 positions by July 31, 2024, as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI? Confirmation must be derived from official company communications, regulatory submissions, or reports from a minimum of two trustworthy news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The job cuts must be directly associated with the AI-focused reorganization strategy announced in 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% and (b) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. If both (a) and (b) occur, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) an increase greater than 0.5% is recorded in India's central bank's preferred inflation measure on a monthly basis, and (b) Uber will have laid off a minimum of 1,800 workers?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the conditions below are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's favored inflation metric indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such rise is documented during this timeframe, this segment of the question will be deemed NO. (b) Uber must have officially announced the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. This confirmation should come from official company statements, regulatory filings, or reports from at least two reputable news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centric reorganization plan introduced in 2023. If Uber acknowledges a lesser number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulations by the resolution date, this part of the question will likewise resolve as NO. Any partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee mark by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. If both (a) and (b) happen, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new President be named in France before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, an individual is officially designated as the new President of France. The appointment must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'new' President signifies a person who is not currently holding this position as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is named by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, continues in office, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on France appointing a new President by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the potential correlation between political changes in France and monetary policy in the UK. 

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, is it true that the Bank of England's base rate will remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024? This will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition about France appointing a new President is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If France has a new President appointed by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base interest rate stay at or above 5.00% during that month?
para_P.body:
This inquiry explores the possible relationship between political shifts in France and the monetary policy of the UK. 

Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially designated in France. This appointment must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the context of this question, a 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently in office as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, is it the case that the Bank of England's base interest rate will remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024? This will be considered TRUE if the Bank of England's base interest rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any time during August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements from the Bank of England or at least two reliable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 5.00% and stays below this threshold throughout August 2024, the question will be answered as FALSE.

If the criterion regarding the appointment of a new President in France is not satisfied, the question will be deemed N/A.

The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both a new President will be appointed in France and the Bank of England's base rate will stay at or above 5.00%?
