If no such settlement is achieved by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or exceeds $4.7 billion, this component will resolve as NO. If both events occur as described, the overall question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Illinois uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not overturned or significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. It will be answered negatively if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will depend on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Conditional on Illinois maintaining its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024, will the HHS's rule on telehealth services be enacted by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. This would mean Illinois maintains its current legal stance on abortion access.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services will be enacted through legal or administrative means? Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If no such rule is enacted and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Illinois continues its current legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024, will the HHS's regulation on telehealth services be implemented by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. This would indicate that Illinois is upholding its existing legal position on abortion access.

Then, can we confirm that by August 31, 2024, a new rule from the Department of Health and Human Services aimed specifically at regulating telehealth services will be officially implemented through legal or administrative channels? The implementation must be validated through official announcements from the HHS, judicial decisions, or other credible legal sources, and must be reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be active and not just proposed or awaiting approval. If no such rule is implemented and active by August 31, 2024, the answer to the question will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Illinois maintains its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024, and (b) the HHS's rule on telehealth services is enacted by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (b) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Illinois continues its present legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024, and (b) the HHS's regulation on telehealth services is implemented by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not overturned or substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. The resolution will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from a minimum of three major news organizations (for instance, Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). The regulation must be in effect and not just proposed or awaiting approval. If either of the criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will YouTube encounter further legal challenges from the U.S. government before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube is subjected to new legal challenges initiated by any entity of the U.S. government. These challenges may consist of, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. For these challenges to qualify, they must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The challenges must be separate from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new challenges are initiated by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will the African Union declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the African Union officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official African Union announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the African Union announce the conclusion of the current mpox epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the African Union formally announces the cessation of the ongoing mpox epidemic by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the African Union or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic in question is the one that led the African Union to issue public health alerts. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union prolongs the emergency declaration past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Given the African Union declares the mpox outbreak over by August 2024, will South Korea's base rate stay at or above 3.50% in August 2024?

Suppose the following is true: The African Union officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition is not met.

This question resolves as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to be at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of South Korea announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources. If the rate is reported to have decreased below 3.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

Verification must come from official announcements by the Central Bank of South Korea or at least two trustworthy financial news sources. If the rate is reported to have fallen below 3.50% and stays below that level for the entirety of August 2024, the answer will be negative.

If the rate is reported to have fallen below 3.50% and stays below this level throughout August 2024, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on his age at the time of his appointment to a major orchestra, such as the London Philharmonic. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that he is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Nicholas Collon be acknowledged as the youngest music director of a prominent orchestra by July 2024?

The acknowledgment must clearly state that he is the youngest individual to occupy such a position. If no such acknowledgment takes place by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in that role, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both Nicholas Collon and Daniel Harding be acknowledged as the youngest music directors among major orchestras?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, both Nicholas Collon and Daniel Harding are officially acknowledged and reported by at least two respected music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a significant orchestra. For Nicholas Collon, this acknowledgment must be based on his age at the time he was appointed to a major orchestra, like the London Philharmonic. For Daniel Harding, the acknowledgment must be based on his age at the time he was appointed to a major orchestra, such as the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. A 'significant orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international acclaim and a regular concert season. The acknowledgment for each must clearly state that they are the youngest individual to occupy such a role. If neither receives such acknowledgment by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in these positions, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a referendum regarding the legalization of marijuana. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing marijuana legalization. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will a vote on marijuana legalization take place in New York before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, New York State officially holds a vote concerning the legalization of marijuana. The vote must be a legitimate, state-wide ballot on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative action specifically related to marijuana legalization. The holding of the vote must be confirmed through official announcements from the state government or reports from at least three major, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such vote occurs by the deadline, or if a scheduled vote is cancelled or postponed past July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that this question pertains solely to the holding of the vote, not its results.

question.title: Given New York holds a referendum on marijuana legalization by July 2024, will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on tax reform by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: New York holds a referendum on marijuana legalization by July 31, 2024. This means that a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing marijuana legalization occurs, verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations.

Then is the following true: Pennsylvania holds a public referendum specifically focused on tax reform by August 31, 2024? This requires a statewide vote officially organized by the state government, with results publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels, directly addressing tax reform by proposing new tax policies or modifying existing ones. General elections with candidates having differing stances on tax do not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, there exist credible accounts or official alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or trustworthy media outlets asserting that Facebook's AI moderation system has been responsible for the dissemination of election misinformation. For this question, 'election misinformation' is defined as inaccurate or deceptive information concerning election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts must originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US television networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference Facebook's AI system and its involvement in spreading election misinformation. Should no such accounts or alerts be released by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a situation where: (a) By August 2024, at least one more U.S. state enacts a 72-hour waiting period for voter registration, AND (b) Ohio eliminates the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following stipulations are fulfilled: (a) By August 31, 2024, a minimum of one additional U.S. state (excluding Maine and those already having similar policies) enacts a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voter registration. This implementation must be verified through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two prominent national news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must be precisely 72 hours; any longer or shorter durations do not qualify. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio publicly declares the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This alteration must be validated through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must work or participate in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If both stipulations are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either or both stipulations are not met by their respective resolution dates, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the U.S. Senate to approve a legislation that reduces NASA's funding by over 20% before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate approves a piece of legislation that entails a budget decrease of more than 20% for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) when compared to its budget for the current fiscal year. The approval must be validated by official Senate documentation and reported by a minimum of two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If the Senate does not pass such a bill by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget reduction is 20% or less, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that mere proposals or discussions regarding budget reductions are not sufficient; the bill must be officially enacted by the Senate.

question.title: Given the U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024, will New York hold a referendum on climate change policy by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

Then, will New York officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on climate change policy by August 31, 2024? The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address climate change, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on climate change does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the U.S. Senate enacts a law reducing NASA's budget by over 20% by August 2024, will New York hold a public vote on climate change policy by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the Senate of the United States enacts legislation that cuts the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) by more than 20% compared to the budget for the current fiscal year. This must be validated by official Senate documentation and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

In that case, will New York carry out an official public vote focused specifically on climate change policy by August 31, 2024? This vote needs to be a statewide referendum, organized by the state government, with results made public by trustworthy news organizations or official state channels. The topic of the referendum must directly concern climate change, proposing new initiatives or modifying existing regulations. A general election featuring candidates with varying views on climate change will not be considered; it must be a dedicated referendum on the subject. If such a referendum does not take place by the specified date, or if a scheduled referendum is canceled or delayed beyond August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% and (b) New York holds a referendum on climate change policy?
question.body: This combined question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, this condition resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate. (b) New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on climate change policy. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address climate change, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on climate change does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this condition resolves as NO. Both conditions must be satisfied for the combined question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place by August 2024: (a) The U.S. Senate approves legislation that reduces NASA's funding by over 20% and (b) New York carries out a public vote on climate change policy?
para_P.body: This combined inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) The Senate of the United States approves a bill that enacts a budget cut exceeding 20% for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) in comparison to its current fiscal year's budget. The approval must be validated by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If the Senate does not pass such a bill by the resolution date, or if it passes a bill with a budget cut of 20% or less, this condition will resolve as NO. Note that simple proposals or discussions regarding budget reductions are insufficient; the bill must be officially sanctioned by the Senate. (b) New York must hold an official public referendum specifically regarding climate change policy. This referendum needs to be a statewide vote, duly organized by the state government, with the results reported publicly by reliable news sources or official state channels. The subject of the referendum must directly pertain to climate change, whether suggesting new initiatives or modifying existing regulations. A general election featuring candidates with varying views on climate change does not qualify; it must be a distinct referendum on the matter. If such a referendum does not take place by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or delayed beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO. Both criteria must be met for the combined question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 250,000 for five straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. The inquiry will be considered NO if this criterion is not fulfilled within the given timeframe. For the purpose of resolution, only the official figures published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor.

Then, will the Bank of England officially announce a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by July 31, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the number of initial weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpasses 250,000 for a duration of five weeks leading up to August 2024, will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: The initial weekly unemployment claims in the United States are reported to be over 250,000 for a continuous five-week period at any time before August 31, 2024, as indicated by the U.S. Department of Labor.

Then, will the Bank of England make a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its interest rate by July 31, 2024? This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or during a press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual members of the BoE will not be considered for determining the outcome.

Criteria for resolution: Resolves to YES if an official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is released by July 31, 2024. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, and (b) the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The resolution will consider only official data from the U.S. Department of Labor. (b) The Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the weekly jobless claims in the U.S. will surpass 250,000 for five straight weeks by August 2024, and (b) the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) The weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as published by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any time before August 31, 2024. Only official figures from the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account for resolution. (b) The Bank of England makes an official announcement regarding a cut in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If either of the conditions is not satisfied, this question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the mpox outbreak in Nigeria be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the mpox epidemic in Nigeria be officially considered concluded by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox epidemic in Nigeria is formally announced as concluded by the nation's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The announcement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the epidemic is still in progress, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on the mpox outbreak in Nigeria being declared over by July 2024, will Congo receive mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The mpox outbreak in Nigeria is declared over by July 31, 2024, by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization, and this declaration is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). Then, will Congo receive mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization by August 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization. This confirmation must come from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. If no such confirmation is made by the resolution date, or if Congo receives mpox vaccines from a source other than the World Health Organization, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the mpox epidemic in Nigeria is officially declared concluded by July 2024, will the World Health Organization provide mpox vaccines to Congo by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider that the following holds true: The mpox epidemic in Nigeria is officially declared concluded by July 31, 2024, either by the nation's health authorities or the World Health Organization, and this announcement is covered by at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). In that case, will Congo obtain mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization by August 31, 2024?

The outcome will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that Congo has received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization. This verification must come from official communications from Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must specifically target the mpox epidemic in Congo. If there is no such verification by the resolution date, or if Congo acquires mpox vaccines from a source other than the World Health Organization, the outcome will be NO.

If the initial condition is not satisfied, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is declared over by July 2024, and (b) Congo receives mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the declaration reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (b) By August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization, with confirmation from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. If either condition is not met by the respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared finished by July 2024, and (b) Congo will receive mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is formally announced as over by the nation's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the announcement being reported by at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (b) By August 31, 2024, it is verified that Congo has obtained mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization, with validation from official communications from Congo's health ministry or coverage from at least two trustworthy international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must specifically target the mpox outbreak in Congo. If either of these criteria is not satisfied by the designated resolution dates, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the monetary policy of the Bank of England.

question.title: Given the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the German economy will avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The outcome resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. It resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: If the Bank of England declares a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, can the German economy escape a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Bank of England makes an official statement regarding an interest rate reduction effective by August 31, 2024. This statement is validated through official communications from the Bank of England, including press releases, announcements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If such a statement is not issued by the resolution date, the condition is deemed unmet.

Then, is it accurate to say that the German economy will not fall into recession by July 31, 2024? For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The outcome is classified as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. It is classified as NO if the German economy records two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (2) The German economy avoids a recession by July 2024?
question.body: (1) The Bank of England must officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The question resolves as YES if such an announcement is made by August 31, 2024. (2) The German economy must not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as YES if the German economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (1) The Bank of England will declare an interest rate reduction by August 2024, and (2) The German economy will steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: (1) The Bank of England is required to formally declare an interest rate reduction that will be effective by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be substantiated by official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. The question is answered with YES if such a declaration is made by August 31, 2024. (2) The German economy must not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question is answered with YES if the German economy does not witness two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The overall question is answered with YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are satisfied.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a resolution be achieved between Google and the UK data protection authority by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a formal agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported violations of data protection laws. The agreement must be validated through official announcements from either party or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such agreement is finalized or publicly acknowledged by the deadline, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or incomplete agreements do not qualify for a YES response.

question.title: Conditional on Google reaching a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024, will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. This settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers), and specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels? This implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

para_P.title: If Google settles with the UK data protection authority by August 2024, will the European Commission impose a major tariff on solar panels from China by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority have reached a formal agreement regarding a penalty levied against Google for supposed violations of data protection regulations. This agreement must be validated by official announcements from either party or reported by at least two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, or leading national newspapers), and must explicitly address the penalty imposed on Google by the UK authority. Ongoing negotiations, appeals, or partial agreements do not meet this criterion.

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, the European Commission will officially enact a tariff of 50% or more on Chinese-manufactured solar panel imports? This enactment must be confirmed by official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two prominent news outlets (including Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must specifically apply to solar panels produced in China and not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google reaches a settlement with the UK data protection authority, and (b) the European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (2) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this condition resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a settlement is reached between Google and the UK data protection authority, and (b) the European Commission enforces a significant tariff on solar panels produced in China?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024: (1) Google and the UK data protection authority come to a formal settlement regarding a penalty imposed on Google for alleged violations of data protection laws. This settlement must be validated by official announcements from either party or reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is not reached or publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, this condition will be answered with NO. Note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not qualify for a YES response. (2) The European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on imports of solar panels made in China. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must specifically target solar panels manufactured in China and not be part of a broader tariff on all goods from China or all electronic products. If no such tariff that meets these conditions is implemented by the designated date, this condition will also resolve as NO. The overall inquiry will resolve as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will the quarterly net profit of Mercedes-Benz rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if Mercedes-Benz discloses a net profit growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the corresponding quarter from the prior year, as detailed in its official financial statements published by July 31, 2024. The growth must be substantiated through official company earnings reports or at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If there is no such growth reported by the resolution date, or if the maximum reported growth is 20% or lower, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter evaluation within the designated period.

question.title: Given Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified by official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), by July 31, 2024. Then, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Mercedes-Benz's net income increase: The question resolves as YES if such an increase is reported and verified by the resolution date. It resolves as NO if no such increase is reported or if the highest increase is 20% or less.

Resolution criteria for the Canadian economy avoiding a recession: The question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. It resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: If Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings grow by over 20% compared to the previous year by July 2024, will Canada steer clear of a recession by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Mercedes-Benz announces a quarterly net earnings growth exceeding 20% when compared to the same quarter from the prior year, as confirmed by official company earnings reports or at least three reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), by July 31, 2024. Then, will Canada avoid entering a recession by July 31, 2024?

Criteria for determining Mercedes-Benz's net earnings growth: The question is answered with YES if such growth is reported and confirmed by the resolution date. It is answered with NO if there is no such growth reported or if the maximum growth reported is 20% or less.

Criteria for determining if Canada avoids a recession: The question is answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Canada does not enter a recession, which is defined as experiencing two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. It is answered with NO if Canada undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (b) the Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). This does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe. (b) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events happen: (a) an increase of over 20% in Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income compared to the previous year, and (b) the Canadian economy remains free from recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz must disclose a net income growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the preceding year, as detailed in its official financial reports. The growth must be corroborated by official company earnings statements or at least three reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). This assessment is not limited to a particular quarter, but rather encompasses any quarter-over-quarter analysis within the designated period. (b) The Canadian economy must not experience a recession, which is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. If either of these conditions fails to be met, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain the Selic rate at 13.25% or higher in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented to be at or exceeding 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Conversely, if the rate is reported to fall below 13.25% and stays beneath this threshold throughout August 2024, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Given the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% in August 2024, will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). 

Then is the following true: By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: If the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank stays at or exceeds 13.25% throughout August 2024, will the agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Selic rate from Brazil's Central Bank is noted to be at or above 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). 

Then, is it accurate to say: By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are either still striking or have not completely returned to regular operations after any ongoing labor dispute. The confirmation regarding the strike or the resumption of work must come from official declarations by agricultural organizations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and must be reported by at least two trustworthy news organizations (like Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have completely resumed work and normal operations are back to usual before or during August 2024, the answer would be NO. Any partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a complete resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, with confirmation from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met. (b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, this condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike. The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: In August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank stays at or exceeds 13.25%, and (b) agricultural workers in Argentina continue their strike?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) At any time during August 2024, the Selic rate from Brazil's Central Bank is noted to be at or above 13.25%, with verification from official announcements from the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Should the rate be reported as having fallen below 13.25% and staying under this threshold throughout August 2024, this requirement is not fulfilled. (b) By the end of August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still engaged in their strike or have not completely returned to normal operations after any ongoing labor dispute. The strike status or the resumption of work must be validated by official communications from agricultural organizations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and covered by at least two trustworthy news sources (like Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely resumed their duties and normal operations have started again before or during August 2024, this requirement is not satisfied. Partial work returns or limited operations do not qualify as a complete resolution of the strike. The question will be marked NO if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a recall of Sara Lee's packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its packaged meat items because of a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following means:

1. An official communication on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms
2. A press announcement from Sara Lee
3. A statement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically referring to a recall by Sara Lee
4. Articles from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the withdrawal of the products. If no recall that meets these conditions is declared by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Given Sara Lee issues a recall due to listeria, will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 deaths by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

Then, is it true that the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce will result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024? This resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Sara Lee announces a recall due to listeria, will the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce lead to over 10 fatalities by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: By August 31, 2024, Sara Lee makes an official statement recalling any of its packaged meat items because of a listeria outbreak. This recall must be verified through at least one of the following channels:

2. A press release issued by Sara Lee
3. A statement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically referencing a recall by Sara Lee
4. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the reason for the withdrawal of the products.

Then, is it accurate to say that the E. coli outbreak related to lettuce will cause more than 10 confirmed fatalities by August 2024? This question is resolved as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official confirmations of more than 10 deaths linked to the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce from a particular supplier. Official confirmation must come from reliable sources such as the CDC or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two trustworthy news organizations. The death count must be specifically connected to this outbreak and must not include deaths from unrelated E. coli incidents. If the death count remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Sara Lee issues a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, and (b) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce results in more than 10 confirmed deaths?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases.

If both conditions are not met by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two events expected to happen by August 2024: (a) Sara Lee recalls packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, and (b) the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce leads to over 10 confirmed fatalities?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

(a) Sara Lee makes an official statement regarding a recall of any of its packaged meat items due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be verified through at least one of these channels:
   1. An official statement on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms
