   The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal.

(b) There are verified reports indicating more than 10 fatalities linked to the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce from a particular producer. Official validation must come from trustworthy sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or similar health authorities, and be covered by at least two reputable news organizations. The death count must be directly related to this outbreak and not include fatalities from unrelated E. coli incidents.

If both conditions are not satisfied by the specified date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the lawsuit initiated by a Texas woman against local officials regarding her arrest connected to an abortion case be settled by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly acknowledged settlement is established in the lawsuit brought forth by a Texas woman against the local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and subsequent murder charge associated with a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially disclosed by the parties involved or reported by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If there is no such settlement confirmed by the given date, or if the case is dismissed or goes to trial without a settlement, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Given a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reaches a settlement by July 2024, will Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post).

Then, will the following be true: By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements? The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If a Texas woman's legal case against local officials regarding an abortion-related arrest concludes with a settlement by July 2024, will Arizona introduce laws limiting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A publicly acknowledged settlement is finalized by July 31, 2024, in the legal action initiated by a Texas woman against local law enforcement and prosecutors in connection with her arrest and subsequent murder accusation tied to a self-managed abortion. This settlement must be officially disclosed by the parties involved or reported by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post).

Then, will the following occur: By August 31, 2024, Arizona formally enacts and implements legislation that enforces new limitations on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, including bladed items or other non-firearm tools? The law must directly pertain to the public carrying of these types of weapons. For a YES outcome, the new legislation must be officially enacted and covered by at least two trustworthy news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news sources). If no such law is passed and enacted by the designated date, or if any enacted law does not specifically limit the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024? (b) Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, this condition resolves as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, this condition resolves as NO. If both conditions are satisfied, the overall question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) Will a settlement be reached by July 2024 in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local authorities concerning her arrest related to abortion? (b) Will Arizona implement laws that limit the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) By July 31, 2024, there is a publicly acknowledged settlement in the lawsuit initiated by a Texas woman against local law enforcement and prosecutors following her arrest and murder accusation tied to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially declared by the parties involved or covered by at least two credible national news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is verified by the deadline, or if the case is either dismissed or goes to trial without a settlement, this condition will be answered as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially enacts laws that impose new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, including bladed instruments or other non-firearm tools. The law must specifically pertain to the public carrying of these items. For a YES outcome, the new legislation must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reliable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona media). If no such laws are enacted by the given date, or if any enacted laws do not specifically limit the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, this condition will be answered as NO. If both criteria are met, the overall question will be answered as YES; otherwise, it will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is Andrew Bailey expected to continue as the Governor of the Bank of England until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if Andrew Bailey is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Verification must be sourced from official announcements by the Bank of England or reported by no fewer than two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer in the Governor position by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or completion of term), the inquiry concludes with a NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as Bailey continuing in the role.

question.title: If Andrew Bailey remains as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024, will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Andrew Bailey remains as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024, confirmed by official announcements or major news outlets. Then, will there be credible reports or official warnings by August 31, 2024, stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation? For this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results, and credible reports must come from at least two reputable sources, such as state or federal election officials, major news outlets, or peer-reviewed studies. The reports must specifically mention the government-developed AI system's role in spreading misinformation.

para_P.title: Should Andrew Bailey continue as the Governor of the Bank of England until July 2024, will there be allegations by August 2024 that a government-created AI system is disseminating misinformation regarding elections?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Andrew Bailey continues to serve as the Governor of the Bank of England until the end of July 2024, as evidenced by official declarations or significant media coverage. Then, by August 31, 2024, will there be trustworthy reports or formal alerts indicating that a government-created AI system is involved in the distribution of misinformation about elections? In this context, 'election misinformation' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive information concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes, and trustworthy reports must originate from at least two credible sources, such as state or federal election authorities, leading news organizations, or peer-reviewed research. The reports must explicitly identify the role of the government-created AI system in the spread of misinformation.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Andrew Bailey remains as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024 and (b) A government-developed AI system is reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024, with confirmation from official Bank of England announcements or at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg. If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason, the condition is not met. Interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as Bailey remaining in the position. (b) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results, and credible reports should come from at least two sources such as state or federal election officials, major news outlets like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks, or peer-reviewed studies in reputable journals. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this condition is not met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Andrew Bailey continues as the Governor of the Bank of England until July 2024 and (b) A government-created AI system is reported for disseminating election misinformation by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) Andrew Bailey is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024, with verification from official announcements from the Bank of England or at least two prominent news organizations such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg. If he has stepped down or is no longer in the position by the resolution date for any reason, this criterion is not satisfied. Appointments of interim or acting Governors do not count as Bailey remaining in his role. (b) By August 31, 2024, there must be credible reports or official alerts from election officials, government bodies, or trustworthy news outlets indicating that a government-created AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' means false or misleading information regarding election procedures, candidates, or outcomes, and credible reports should originate from at least two sources such as state or federal election officials, major news organizations like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or prominent US networks, or peer-reviewed research in respected journals. If no such reports or alerts are issued by the resolution date, this condition is not fulfilled. Both criteria (a) and (b) must be met for the inquiry to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is the factory initiative of a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio expected to be scrapped by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's proposal to establish a factory in Ohio has been officially abandoned. Verification must be provided through official announcements from the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The abandonment must be a complete cessation of the project, not merely a postponement or alteration. If the initiative is still active, under consideration, or has not been formally abandoned by this deadline, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. In this context, 'abandonment' refers to the company having officially retracted its plans or the state having definitively denied the project.

question.title: If a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio is canceled by August 2024, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

Then, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: Should the South Korean battery manufacturer's factory initiative in Ohio be called off by August 2024, will the KOSPI index of South Korea achieve or surpass 3,500 points by that same month?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's intention to establish a factory in Ohio has been officially scrapped. question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Conditional on the establishment of an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members by July 2024, will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

Then, will Michigan conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024? For Michigan to hold such a referendum, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.

The question will resolve as NO if:

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Sony Corporation resolving a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?

For the outcome to resolve as YES, the United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery, verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

Under this condition, will the U.S. continue to enforce a 100% tariff on machinery manufactured in China through August 31, 2024? For the outcome to be YES, the U.S. must persist in applying a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery, verifiable through official U.S. government channels (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two reputable media organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Should the tariff be reduced below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time on or before August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly characterized as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

The question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Sony Corporation successfully ends a significant workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States sustains a 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Sony Corporation successfully negotiates an agreement with its unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a considerable number of workers from Sony Corporation (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must continue for a minimum of one week.
   3. The resolution must be verified by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the involved labor union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no resolution meeting all these requirements occurs by the stated date, or if no significant strike takes place, this part will be answered as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States persists in enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery produced in China. The existence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed by official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly labeled as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not impact the resolution of this part.

The question will resolve as YES only if both stipulations (a) and (b) are met. If either stipulation is not fulfilled, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Australian economy has not fallen into a recession. For this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The response will be NO if the Australian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given the Australian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will U.S. previously occupied home sales decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Australian economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this condition, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, and the economy must not experience such a recession between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, is it true that U.S. previously occupied home sales will show a decline for two consecutive months by July 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month, verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the Australian economy successfully sidesteps a recession by July 2024, will there be a drop in U.S. sales of previously owned homes for two straight months by that same date?
para_P.body:

For this context, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as indicated by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, and the economy must not encounter such a recession from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

In that case, is it accurate to say that U.S. sales of previously owned homes will experience a decrease for two consecutive months by July 31, 2024? This will be affirmed as YES if there are two consecutive months where the sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. decline compared to the preceding month, confirmed by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other acknowledged real estate market analysts. The declines must be calculated in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly decreases are recorded by the resolution date, or if only one month indicates a decline, the outcome will be NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Australian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) There are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month, verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors, in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following happen: (a) The Australian economy remains free from recession, and (b) U.S. sales of previously owned homes decrease for two months in a row?

(b) There are two successive months in which the sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. show a drop compared to the prior month, confirmed by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors, based on seasonally adjusted annual rates. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the Bovespa index recover to its October 2023 level by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bovespa index closes at or above its closing level as of October 1, 2023. If the Bovespa index does not reach or exceed its October 1, 2023 closing level by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Given the Bovespa index recovers to its October 2023 level by August 2024, will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

Then, will the Bank of Korea publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such legislation is enacted by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a piece of legislation is enacted but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

para_P.title: Will the Bovespa index in Brazil hit or surpass 130,000 points before August 2024?

It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for this resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). Intraday highs count for resolution. This will be verified through official index data from trustworthy financial market information sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.title: Conditional on Arizona holding a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, will Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the condition is not met.

Given this condition, will Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 31, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban, with confirmation from a Wisconsin state court and reported by at least two reputable national news sources. If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Takeda permit the production of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda makes an official announcement or confirmation that it will permit the production of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication, thereby choosing not to enforce its patent. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must be derived from official statements from the company, declarations from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or prominent national newspapers). question.title: Conditional on Takeda allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

Given this, will the WHO declare, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency? For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition about Takeda is not met, the resolution is N/A.

Given this scenario, will the WHO announce, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer deemed a global emergency? For a YES outcome:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer classified as a global emergency.
2. This statement must be covered by at least two significant international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa, rather than a general global Rift Valley fever issue.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically mention the East African situation.
3. The WHO retains or intensifies the emergency status of the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa.

Note: If the WHO has already stated that the East African Rift Valley fever situation is no longer a global emergency before the start date of this question, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition regarding Takeda is unmet, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Takeda allows generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, and (b) the WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   - The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not met.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to happen: (a) Takeda permits the generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024, and (b) the WHO announces that the Rift Valley fever crisis in East Africa is no longer a worldwide emergency by August 2024?

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

The inquiry will resolve as NO if either of the aforementioned criteria is not satisfied.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?

Any conjecture regarding potential rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Given the Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body:

The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, will the Central Bank of Singapore officially announce a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore, and it must explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Nigeria announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

question.title: Given the Central Bank of Nigeria announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the European Central Bank also announce an interest rate cut by then?

Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. It is important to note that for both banks, the actual date of implementation for the rate cut may occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the declarations themselves are made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate for the Central Bank of Nigeria and the main refinancing operations rate for the European Central Bank, which serve as their primary monetary policy instruments.

question.title: Will LG Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if LG Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will Indiana conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?

question.title: Given Indiana holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive by July 2024?

The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries? The healthy behavior incentive must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Russia declare a prosperous winter harvest for wheat and barley by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia announces a prosperous winter harvest for wheat and barley, indicated by yields that are at least equal to or surpass the average of the previous five years. The prosperity must be validated by official agricultural data from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). In this context, 'prosperous' is defined as the total output of wheat and barley being no less than 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these requirements, or if there is inadequate data to reach a conclusion, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Russia reporting a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, will Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024 (b) Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?

The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this component, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) by August 2024, Russia will announce a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, and (b) by July 2024, Russia will declare intentions to construct additional nuclear reactors beyond the two already planned?

For this aspect, 'successful' means that the total production of wheat and barley is at least 5% greater than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these criteria, or if there is insufficient data to make a judgment, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government must publicly announce plans to develop more nuclear reactors in addition to the two currently proposed. This announcement must originate from an official government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and must be reported by at least two significant international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must explicitly express an intention to build extra reactors beyond the two already in the pipeline, rather than merely expanding or modifying the existing plans. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement merely reiterates or updates the existing two-reactor plan, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the UNDP announces over $400 million in new funding by July 2024, will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body:

The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. 

Then, will a major hospital system in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions by August 31, 2024? The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The verification must originate from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent US newspapers). If the prohibition is not affirmed as constitutional by the given date, or if a court determines it to be unconstitutional, the inquiry will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, an 'almost complete abortion prohibition' pertains to the law that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referred to in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Given Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional by August 2024, will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban, with confirmation from a Louisiana state court and reported by at least two reputable national news sources. This refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment as of October 1, 2023. Given this, will Missouri conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024? For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri, focused primarily on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Louisiana's nearly complete abortion prohibition is ruled constitutional by August 2024, will Missouri hold a vote on abortion rights before that date?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: By August 31, 2024, a judicial decision affirms the legality of Louisiana's nearly complete abortion prohibition, with validation from a Louisiana state court and coverage by at least two credible national news outlets. This pertains to the law that was previously blocked and is awaiting evaluation as of October 1, 2023. In light of this, will Missouri organize a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights by August 31, 2024? For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Missouri, concentrating specifically on the safeguarding of abortion rights, and the results must be made public through official state communications or widely acknowledged news organizations. If such a vote that meets these requirements does not take place by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional, and (2) Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

1. Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional by a Louisiana state court, and this is reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The ban refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment as of October 1, 2023.

2. Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri, with the primary focus on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If both of these conditions are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be affirmed, and (2) Missouri hold a referendum regarding abortion rights?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent events occur by August 31, 2024:

1. A Louisiana state court affirms the constitutionality of the near-total abortion ban, and this is reported by no fewer than two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). This ban pertains to the legislation that was previously blocked and is awaiting evaluation as of October 1, 2023.

2. Missouri organizes a public referendum aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. The referendum must be officially announced and carried out by the state of Missouri, with a clear emphasis on safeguarding abortion rights, and the outcomes must be reported publicly by official state sources or well-known news organizations.

If both conditions are satisfied by the designated date, the answer will be YES. If either or both of the conditions fail to be fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the inflation metric favored by China's central bank to demonstrate a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the inflation metric favored by China's central bank indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the South China Morning Post). If there is no such rise recorded during this timeframe, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Given China's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post).

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, Samsung will publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce? The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans.

para_P.title: If the inflation measure favored by China's central bank indicates a monthly rise of more than 0.5% by July 2024, will Samsung reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: the inflation metric preferred by China's central bank shows a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. Then, is it accurate to say that by July 31, 2024, Samsung will make a public declaration regarding plans to boost its AI workforce? This declaration must be communicated through official company channels (like press releases, investor relations announcements, or official social media profiles) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely implied from broader hiring strategies.

(b) Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 31, 2024. The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) a monthly rise of over 0.5% in the inflation measure favored by China's central bank, and (b) an announcement from Samsung regarding an expansion of its AI workforce?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) the inflation measure preferred by China's central bank shows a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially reported by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the South China Morning Post). The increase in AI workforce must be explicitly mentioned and not simply inferred from general hiring intentions. If either of these criteria is unmet, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

para_P.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid program, which includes work requirements, have at least 25,000 participants by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid program that incorporates a work requirement has registered a minimum of 25,000 low-income individuals. The enrollment data must be validated by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement must remain a part of the plan throughout this timeframe. If the number of enrollees is less than 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is eliminated from the program, the answer will be NO. Should there be any legal disputes or federal actions that significantly change the structure or execution of the plan, the determination will still be based on the enrollment figures of the original program or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Conditional on Virginia's Medicaid plan enrolling at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024, will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents, with enrollment figures confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources. The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed, the condition is not met. In case of legal challenges or federal interventions, the condition is still based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

Then, will Apple Inc. reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no such resolution is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Virginia's Medicaid program has at least 25,000 beneficiaries enrolled by July 2024, will Apple Inc. settle a significant workers' strike by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid program, which mandates work participation, has successfully enrolled no fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals, with these enrollment numbers verified by official state documentation, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three credible news outlets. The program must retain its work requirement throughout this timeframe. Should the enrollment fall short of 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is eliminated, the condition is not satisfied. In the event of legal disputes or federal actions, the condition still relies on the enrollment figures of the original program or its nearest equivalent.

Then, will Apple Inc. come to a resolution with union workers, thereby concluding a major strike by July 31, 2024? This strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 participants, persist for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed through official announcements from both Apple Inc. and the participating union, along with coverage by at least two respected international news organizations. If such a resolution is not reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls at least 25,000 beneficiaries, and (b) Apple Inc. resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement must remain part of the plan throughout the period. The question resolves as NO if enrollment is below 25,000, the work requirement is removed, or legal/federal interventions significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation.

(b) Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike involving at least 1,000 workers and lasting at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). The question resolves as NO if no such resolution is achieved, or if no significant strike occurs.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Virginia's Medicaid program with work requirements will have enrolled a minimum of 25,000 beneficiaries, and (b) Apple Inc. will have successfully negotiated an end to a major workers' strike?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid program, which mandates work requirements, enrolls no fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals. Enrollment verification must come from official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three well-known news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement must continue to be a part of the program throughout this timeframe. The inquiry will be answered with NO if enrollment falls short of 25,000, if the work requirement is eliminated, or if legal or federal actions significantly modify the program's framework or execution.

(b) Apple Inc. successfully negotiates with unionized employees, bringing an end to a significant strike involving at least 1,000 workers that lasts for a minimum of one week. This resolution must be corroborated by official announcements from both Apple Inc. and the relevant union, and reported by at least two credible international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). The inquiry will be answered with NO if such a resolution is not reached, or if no significant strike occurs.

question.title: Will Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024. For the purpose of this question, temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

para_P.title: Will Pedro Sánchez still be the Prime Minister of Spain by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Pedro Sánchez remains in the role of Prime Minister of Spain until July 31, 2024. Verification must be obtained from official records of the Spanish government or reputable news sources from at least two prominent news outlets (such as El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The inquiry will be deemed negative if Sánchez departs from or is ousted from the role at any time prior to or during July 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, temporary leaves due to health issues or vacations do not count as leaving the position.

question.title: Given Pedro Sánchez remains the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024, will Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024, as confirmed by official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

Then, given this, will Boris Johnson continue to hold the position of Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024? Confirmation must come from official UK government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if Johnson leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024, with temporary absences due to illness or vacation not counting as leaving the position.

para_P.title: If Pedro Sánchez stays as Spain's Prime Minister until July 2024, will Boris Johnson still be the UK's Prime Minister by then?
