Temporary absences for reasons like illness or vacation do not count as vacating the position.

Then, based on this scenario, will Boris Johnson persist in his role as Prime Minister of the UK until July 31, 2024? Verification must come from official records of the UK government or reliable news reports from at least two major news organizations (like BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, AFP). The answer will be NO if Johnson departs or is ousted from his role at any time before or during July 2024, with temporary absences due to illness or vacation not considered as leaving the position.

question.title: Will both Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain and Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024, and (2) Boris Johnson continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024. 

For Pedro Sánchez, confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

para_P.title: Will both Pedro Sánchez and Boris Johnson continue to serve as Prime Ministers of Spain and the UK, respectively, until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if the following conditions are met: (1) Pedro Sánchez remains in the role of Prime Minister of Spain until July 31, 2024, and (2) Boris Johnson remains in the role of Prime Minister of the UK until July 31, 2024. 

For Pedro Sánchez, verification must be obtained from official records of the Spanish government or trustworthy news sources from at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The answer will be NO if Johnson departs or is dismissed from the role at any time before or during July 2024. Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of Indonesia will introduce a fresh monetary easing strategy by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmatively resolved if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia makes an official declaration regarding a new monetary easing strategy. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Indonesia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The declaration should clearly outline the new monetary easing strategy. Furthermore, the announcement must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed legitimate. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia continues with its existing policy, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given the Central Bank of Indonesia announces a new monetary easing policy by August 2024, will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. This announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia, and it must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid.

Given this, will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 31, 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution.

para_P.title: If the Central Bank of Indonesia reveals a new monetary easing strategy by August 2024, will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points by that time?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially discloses a new monetary easing strategy. This disclosure must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Indonesia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia, and it must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid.

In light of this, will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points by August 31, 2024? This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, according to official index reports from trustworthy financial market data providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday peaks are included for resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Indonesia announces a new monetary easing policy, and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Indonesia must officially announce a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (b) The Singapore Straits Times Index must reach or exceed 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) the Central Bank of Indonesia makes a public announcement regarding a new monetary easing policy, and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Indonesia must make an official declaration about a new monetary easing policy. This declaration should come from a recognized communication channel of the Central Bank of Indonesia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement must clearly outline the new monetary easing policy and be reported by a minimum of two major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. (b) The Singapore Straits Times Index must reach or exceed 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from credible financial market data providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday peaks are sufficient for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. If either requirement is not fulfilled, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be an official connection between Green Acres Co. and a new salmonella outbreak?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially associated with a new salmonella outbreak that is distinct from any previously documented cases. The association must be validated by U.S. federal health authorities (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak needs to be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have taken place after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is connected to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Given Green Acres Co. is linked to a new salmonella outbreak, will the FDA recall ground basil for lead by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. This link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023.

Then, will the following be true: By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Considering that Green Acres Co. is associated with a recent salmonella outbreak, will the FDA withdraw ground basil due to lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: By July 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Green Acres Co. is connected to a new salmonella outbreak distinct from any previously documented incidents. This connection must be verified by U.S. federal health authorities (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to Green Acres Co.'s products and must have taken place after October 1, 2023.

Then, will the following statement hold true: By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) formally announces a recall of any ground basil products due to lead contamination. This recall must be validated through official FDA communications or reports from at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is interpreted as an official request from the FDA to manufacturers to take their products off the shelves. Alerts or warnings that do not constitute an official recall do not meet the criteria for a YES response.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak and (b) the FDA issues a recall for ground basil products due to lead contamination?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak, which must be different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Nigeria's Senate approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu is against?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate approves a significant economic reform legislation that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the Senate, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Nigeria's Senate passing a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024, will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body:

The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and it must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

Given this condition, will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 31, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition regarding Nigeria's Senate is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: If President Biden delivers a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024, will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?

question.title: Given a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

Then, will Hyundai Motor Company reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current West Nile virus outbreak?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces that the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak has concluded by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official statements or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no official declaration ending the outbreak is made by the specified resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Conditional on WHO declaring the West Nile virus outbreak over, will Land O'Frost recall deli meats due to listeria by August 2024?
question.body:
This question examines whether Land O'Frost will issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 31, 2024, conditional on the World Health Organization (WHO) declaring the current West Nile virus outbreak over by the same date.

Condition: The WHO must officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).

Outcome: The question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the WHO announces that the West Nile virus outbreak has ended, will Land O'Frost pull back deli meats due to listeria by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:

Condition: The WHO must officially state that the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak has ended by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be verified through formal WHO statements or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).

Outcome: The inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost publicly declares a recall of any of its deli meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be corroborated by at least one of the following sources:

1. An official statement on Land O'Frost's website or social media platforms
2. A press release issued by Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically referring to a Land O'Frost recall
4. Articles from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing authoritative sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these specifications is announced by the designated date, the inquiry will resolve as NO. If the condition is not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the current West Nile virus outbreak over, and (b) Land O'Frost issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over. question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the Swiss National Bank announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the UK economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Indiana hold a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?

3. The outcomes of the public vote must be reported by official state sources or widely recognized news outlets.

If no such public vote that meets these requirements takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually executing it by the given date does not qualify for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Conditional on Indiana conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will Tennessee hold a referendum on healthcare funding by July 2024?

question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not fall into a recession. question.title: Conditional on the South Korean economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the South Korean economy's performance and the WHO's declaration regarding the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria. 

Suppose the following is true: 
- The South Korean economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea within the period from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

Then, is the following also true? 
- By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For this to resolve as YES:
  1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
  2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
  3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question resolves as NO if the WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024, or if it maintains or escalates the emergency status of the outbreak.

- By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer classified as a global emergency. For this to be affirmed as YES:
  1. The WHO must publicly declare that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer regarded as a global emergency.
  2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
  3. The announcement must specifically address the outbreak in Nigeria, rather than a general global Lassa fever scenario.

The inquiry will be deemed NO if the WHO does not issue such a statement by August 31, 2024, or if it upholds or intensifies the emergency designation of the outbreak.
